key.frycparry.key_parry: Parry (set it to Unbound to parry with Use Key)
text.autoconfig.frycparry.title: Sword Parry Config
Enable blocking with other items [Restart Required]
For items that are not swords, shovels, axes (etc), but have attack speed attribute
Disable block action after parrying axe attack
When turned on, axe attack will set cooldown whether it was parry or not
Dual wielding settings [Restart Required]
text.autoconfig.frycparry.option.modifie: Multiply knockback strength for players by:
Knockback strength is multiplied by this value for PvP
Multiply disarm duration for mobs by:
Disarm duration is multiplied by this value for mobs

Parry effects [/reload Required]

List of status effects, that can be applied to attacker, in the following pattern: 
 'StatusEffect;duration;amplifier;chance;enchantmentModifier;StatusEffect;duration;amplifier;chance;enchantmentModifier' 
 chance: 1.0 = 100% 
 enchantmentModifier: 0.4 = 40% longer duration per Parry enchantment level

 enchantmentModifier: 0.4 = 40% longer duration per Parry enchantment level

text.autoconfig.frycparry.option.pickaxe: Block delay [/reload Required]
Block delay [/reload Required]
Block delay [/reload Required]
Parry ticks start counting AFTER block delay 
 For example, when block delay is 5, and parry ticks is 2, 6th and 7th tick counts as parry

Explosion block delay [/reload Required]
text.autoconfig.frycparry.option.pickaxe: Explosion block delay [/reload Required]
Explosion block delay [/reload Required]
Explosion block delay [/reload Required]
When this value is below 0, explosions can't be blocked
 0 means no delay (but normal block delay is still taken into account)
 If normal block delay is higher than this value (and this value is higher than -1), then this value does nothing
 If normal block delay is 0 and this value is 5, first 5 ticks of blocking grants 80% less protection from explosions
text.autoconfig.frycparry.option.sword.e:
When this value is below 0, explosions can't be blocked
 0 means no delay (but normal block delay is still taken into account)
 If normal block delay is higher than this value (and this value is higher than -1), then this value does nothing
 If normal block delay is 0 and this value is 5, first 5 ticks of blocking grants 80% less protection from explosions

% of damage taken after blocking explosion [/reload Required]
% of damage TAKEN (not reduced) after blocking explosion: the higher this value, the more damage player takes when blocking
 This option doesn't do anything unless explosionBlockDelay is above -1

 This option doesn't do anything unless explosionBlockDelay is above -1

Cooldown after attacking [/reload Required]
text.autoconfig.frycparry.option.pickaxe: Cooldown after attacking [/reload Required]
Cooldown after attacking [/reload Required]
Cooldown after attacking [/reload Required]
Values above 0 describe number of ticks item will be disabled for
 When this value is below zero, cooldown is based on attack speed and the value is multiplier
 (For example, if this value is set to -0.5, cooldown will be: valueBasedOnAttackSpeed * 0.5)
text.autoconfig.frycparry.option.sword.c:

text.autoconfig.frycparry.option.enchant: Make enchantments for shield appear on swords and axes found in chests
This option doesn't do anything when blocking with axes and swords is disabled (or enchantments are disabled)
Disabled enchantments are unobtainable in survival mode
Disabled enchantments are unobtainable in survival mode
Disabled enchantments are unobtainable in survival mode
Set it to 0 to make shield unenchantable

Increases amplifier of parry effects by this value when item has Parry II
If you want to strengthen only some of the effects, decrease amplifier of the effects you don't want to be strengthened:
  For example, if this option is set to 2, and parrying applies instant damage I, setting instant damage's amplifier to -1 will
  prevent parry enchantment from increasing the amplifier (still instant damage I will be applied)
